input.name: Enable Events
input.narrative: Flag to indicate that events should be enabled / disabled on the attached instance - defaulted to True

output.name: handle
output.narrative: An integer which can be used to identify the created instance in subsequent actions

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the required workbook should be opened. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: File name
input.narrative: The path and name of the file which should be opened.

output.name: Workbook Name
output.narrative: The name used by Excel to identify the workbook - usually this is the file name (without the path).

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the worksheet which should be retrieved resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook which contains the sheet required. The default empty text indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet within the specified workbook which should be written to a collection. The default empty text indicates the currently active worksheet within the specified workbook.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The collection containing the data from the specified worksheet - the column IDs will be gleaned from the first row on the sheet being retrieved.

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Data
input.narrative: A collection containing the data, one row for each item to be added

input.name: Defer Until
input.narrative: Optionally, the date/time the new item(s) should be deferred until

input.name: Priority
input.narrative: Optionally, the priority for the new item(s). Lower numbers represent higher priorities. The default is 0.

input.name: Tags
input.narrative: Optionally, a semi-colon-separated set of tags to apply to the queue item(s)

input.name: Status
input.narrative: Optionally, the initial status required of the work queue item(s)

output.name: Item IDs
output.narrative: The IDs of the items which have been added to the queue, in the order of the collection of data passed that was input

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

output.name: Item ID
output.narrative: The ID of the item retrieved - empty if there are none available.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

output.name: Status
output.narrative: The status of the item.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

input.name: Main Collection
input.narrative: The collection to append to.

input.name: Collection to Append
input.narrative: The collection to append.

output.name: Combined Collection
output.narrative: The combined collection.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Exception Reason
input.narrative: A description of the reason for the exception

input.name: Retry
input.narrative: Whether or not to retry the item, up to the maximum number of attempts specified for the queue. Optional - if not specified, the item will be retried

input.name: Keep Locked
input.narrative: Whether or not the clone of the item should remain locked after the exception has been registered and the item is retried. Optional - default is False

output.name: New Item ID
output.narrative: The Item ID of the newly cloned item. This item will be locked if 'Keep Locked' is True. This will be empty if no item was cloned (ie. the item was not retried.

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the required lock. Mandatory parameter.

input.name: Timeout
input.narrative: The maximum amount of time to await the lock. Default is to wait forever

input.name: Preferred Token
input.narrative: The preferred token to use for the lock. Default behaviour is to generate a new unique token.

input.name: Comment
input.narrative: The comments to set on the lock

output.name: Token
output.narrative: The token registered against the lock. This will be empty if the lock could not be acquired

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the specific lock to be released. Default behaviour is to release all locks with the given token.

input.name: Comment
input.narrative: The comments to set on the lock(s)

input.name: Token
input.narrative: The token associated with the lock(s) to be released. Mandatory parameter.

input.name: All Sessions
input.narrative: True to release locks matching the specified constraints across all sessions; False to only release locks acquired in the current session. Default is False

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the workbook which should be closed resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook which should be closed.

input.name: Save Data
input.narrative: True to save the data before closing the workbook; The default of False will discard any changes before closing the workbook.

input.name: Name
input.narrative: The name of the required lock. Mandatory parameter.

input.name: Timeout
input.narrative: The maximum amount of time to await the lock. Default is to wait forever

input.name: Preferred Token
input.narrative: The preferred token to use for the lock. Default behaviour is to generate a new unique token.

input.name: Comment
input.narrative: The comments to set on the lock

output.name: Token
output.narrative: The token registered against the lock. This will be empty if the lock could not be acquired

input.name: Enable Events
input.narrative: Flag to indicate that events should be enabled / disabled on the attached instance - defaulted to True

output.name: handle
output.narrative: An integer which can be used to identify the created instance in subsequent actions

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the required workbook should be opened. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: File name
input.narrative: The path and name of the file which should be opened.

output.name: Workbook Name
output.narrative: The name used by Excel to identify the workbook - usually this is the file name (without the path).

input.name: Sleep Time (Seconds)
input.narrative: The time (in seconds) for which to sleep

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the number of rows is required. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook on which the number of rows is required. The default empty text value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet on which the number of rows is required. The default empty text value indicates the currently active sheet on the specified workbook.

output.name: Number of rows
output.narrative: The number of rows.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the worksheet which should be activated resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook in which the sheet exists - The default empty value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the sheet which should be activated. The default empty text value indicates that the currently active sheet should be, er, activated, making this a no-op.

input.name: Create If Missing?
input.narrative: True to create the sheet if it isn't present on the specified workbook; False to not do so.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the number of rows is required. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook on which the number of rows is required. The default empty text value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet of interest; it will be checked for existence

output.name: Worksheet Exists
output.narrative: Indicates whether or not the named worksheet exists

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the worksheet should be created. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook in which the sheet should be created - The default empty value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the sheet which should be activated. The default empty text value indicates that the currently active sheet should be, er, activated, making this a no-op.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the required cell value should be set. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Cell Reference
input.narrative: The reference on the speficied sheet identifying the cell which should be set.

input.name: Value
input.narrative: The value to which the specified cell should be set.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the required cell value should be set. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the specified collection should be written. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook within which the data should be written. The default empty value indicates the current workbook within the specified instance.

input.name: Collection
input.narrative: The collection containing the data which should be written to the worksheet.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet on which the given data should be written. The default empty value indicates the current sheet within the specified workbook.

input.name: Cell Reference
input.narrative: The reference at which the collection should be written.

input.name: Include Column Names
input.narrative: True to indicate that the column names from the collection should be written out as the first row; False to ignore the column names and just write out the data.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the number of rows is required. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook on which the number of rows is required. The default empty text value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet on which the number of rows is required. The default empty text value indicates the currently active sheet on the specified workbook.

output.name: Number of rows
output.narrative: The number of rows.

input.name: Collection
input.narrative: The collection to sort.

input.name: Sort Field
input.narrative: The field to sort by.

input.name: Ascending Order
input.narrative: True to sort in ascending order.

output.name: Sorted Collection
output.narrative: The sorted collection.

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if sorting was successful.

output.name: Message
output.narrative: An error message when sorting failed.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the specified collection should be written. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook within which the data should be written. The default empty value indicates the current workbook within the specified instance.

input.name: Collection
input.narrative: The collection containing the data which should be written to the worksheet.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet on which the given data should be written. The default empty value indicates the current sheet within the specified workbook.

input.name: Cell Reference
input.narrative: The reference at which the collection should be written.

input.name: Include Column Names
input.narrative: True to indicate that the column names from the collection should be written out as the first row; False to ignore the column names and just write out the data.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the worksheet which should be deleted resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook which contains the sheet to be deleted. The default empty value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet to be deleted. The default empty value indicates the currently active worksheet.

input.name: Sleep Time (Seconds)
input.narrative: The time (in seconds) for which to sleep
